Description: Pair of silver ear-rings, probably once gilded: wire ring ring fastened by a hook and loop; on the end near the loop are three globular, slightly oval beads covered with filigree circles; the spaces between the beads are filled with fine wire twisted round the ring; the second ear-ring is incomplete, and has three beads.
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (2565)
